job_title: Student Library Assistant in Sacramento, CA
pros: Friendly people, great academic environment, decent pay for student workers
cons: I was a student worker, so can't really speak comprehensively . . . but I can't think of any.

pros: A warm interfaith atmosphere, engaged students, proximity to UC Berkeley
cons: Budget concerns have curtailed some services

review_title: Great place to work in a stimulating and diverse environment
pros: Very professionally run working environment.  Many long term employees are at the school that can be both a benefit with their in depth understanding of operations and at times be a detriment from their resistance to changes. Overall there is general desire and commitment by all to provide a quality learning experience to a very diverse group of students from a Consortium of higher educational theological schools. Beautiful location.  Great benefits.  Lots of paid holidays.  The Executive Management seems to honestly value employees and their professional contribution to the school.  The school supports and encourages ongoing growth and development for employees.
cons: Can be challenging working in an environment consisting of multiple member schools.  Inter-school politics can be draining and damaging to employee moral.

review_title: A great place to work in a beautiful location.
pros: Great location. Work with a diverse group of people.  Great benefits package. Many paid holidays throughout the year.  your good work will be appreciated by others at the GTU. .
cons: Pay scale is on the low side. Some long term employees can be difficult to work with and will resist changes, making it difficult to make improvements.  Not much opportunity for promotion within the school.

pros: Great benefits and comfortable work environment.
cons: Would like to re-locate to Sacramento, CA. Would be too far of a commute.
